Title.evidence: A Randomised Controlled Trial of the Alfalfa App for Warfarin Management in Post-Cardiac Valve Replacement Patients

Trial_Design.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 using a Microsoft Excel-generated list.

Participants.evidence: Participants were eligible if they had been on warfarin for at least 3 months, received warfarin management through the Alfalfa app or pharmacist-led clinic visits, and had no serious bleeding or thrombotic events in the prior 3 months.

Intervention.evidence: received warfarin management through the Alfalfa app or pharmacist-led clinic visits

Objective.evidence: This study evaluates the efficacy, safety, and cost-effectiveness of the Alfalfa app for warfarin management compared to offline methods.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the time in therapeutic range (TTR) over 3 months.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Participants were randomised 1:1 using a Microsoft Excel-generated list.

Number_Randomised.evidence: A total of 405 participants were analysed (204 in the Alfalfa group, 201 in the offline group).

Number_Analysed.evidence: A total of 405 participants were analysed (204 in the Alfalfa group, 201 in the offline group).

Result_Outcome.evidence: The Alfalfa group had a higher TTR (66.46% vs 46.65%, P <.001) and monitoring frequency (8.14 vs 4.47, P <.001).

Harms.evidence: Minor bleeding was more frequent in the Alfalfa group (5.9% vs 1.5%, P =.02).
